website_summaries.verdict: For beginning podcasters and voice chatters, the Logitech USB Desktop Microphone offers good sound quality for a very palatable price.
pros: decent sound quality for the price

customer_reviews.title: VIDEO: Audio Comparisons Review! Must WATCH!
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, I figured this would help you to see the difference in audio quality between the USB Microphone, a Logitech C910 Webcam Microphone, and a built in laptop microphone. The USB microphone is far superior. Be sure to watch the video below, and if this review was helpful, THUMBS it up so other people can see it. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Thompson

customer_reviews.title: hard to find, have to buy used
customer_reviews.text: Why Logitech stopped making this microphone is beyond me. I have two of them, one I bought new and the other refurbed because logitech doesn't make them anymore. The sound quality is great, it looks like a pro microphone on my desktop. I've been using them for years for online meetings. They hold up really well and sound great. The mute button lights up when the microphone is un-muted so you won't make any boo boos. Worth buying one used / refurbed, nothing touches this microphone for looks / usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: Tezza

customer_reviews.title: Four Years And Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microphone to assist with conversation via computer, and I must say, I am very happy with it. The microphone came well packaged with good instructions. Plug it into a USB port, click on the microphone button and off you go, pretty self explanatory. A friend thought this was expensive for the product, but I have found that I get clean, crisp sound, no real ambient noise, and it serves it's purpose. I have had this microphone for four years with absolutely no problems, that is exceptional in this day and age. If it collects dust, I just wipe it off. Very little care for this microphone, and a lot of positive aspects. Recommended. prisrob 06-05-15
customer_reviews.author: prisrob

customer_reviews.title: While this microphone certainly isn't the best quality microphone around (if you're looking for that
customer_reviews.text: While this microphone certainly isn't the best quality microphone around (if you're looking for that, I'd point you in the direction of the Blue Snowball or Blue Yeti, among a few others). But this is certainly enough to get the job done, and if you're looking for sound quality for unprofessional work, I'd highly recommend this mic. When communicating with others, whether through Skype or online, your voice will be clearly heard and understood. If you're on a budget and are looking for a good mic at a cheap price, this is a good option!
customer_reviews.author: M. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent For Dragon Naturally Speaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone to improve dictation using Dragon Naturally Speaking Version 11. It works very well for this purpose. Previously I used the microphone from a Microsoft Video Conference Camera. I found that by switching to the logitech microphone, positioned much closer to the mouth than the Video Conference Camera is, that the accuracy of dictation improves significantly. With respect to the logitech microphone: Set up was simple on Windows 7 - plug and play - one minute to set up. The microphone is nicely weighted, and doesn't tip easily; I find the on/off button is very handy; and overall, the unit just feels well made. I'm very satisified. Great price/value.
customer_reviews.author: Chartreuse Magenta

customer_reviews.title: Great, standard microphone
customer_reviews.text: I got this USB microphone, because I messed around with my computer too much, and I broke the microphone port on my computer. Instead of fixing it, then this microphone was a great alternative, since it installs a sound driver automatically. It looks really plain, but you're probably getting this just for functionality, not for show. It has a button with a light that turns on when the microphone is on, so you have a nice visual cue if people can hear you. The sound quality is really good, too. Pros: +Standard microphone +It works without any trouble +Good sound quality Cons: -Plain looking
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dewey

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mic! I game a lot and most people ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mic! I game a lot and most people think I am using a headphone mic due to the clarity. It also doesn't seem to pick up background noises like from a fan or the usual things that cause havoc for an open mic. The only reason I had to buy another one is because I found my old one of 10+ years didn't like a full glass of tea spilled on it. Hmmmmm just don't know why it wouldn't like my sweet brewed tea.
customer_reviews.author: Danna Hatchett

customer_reviews.title: really impressed with this mic.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using this mic yesterday and was expecting it to have the small pin type plug in, but instead it has a USB Plug in and I could plug it in in the front panel instead of pulling out the big PC case to get to the mic jack in the back. Wow this self installed and Skype was up and working with my son in maybe 2 minutes. How a USB Mic routes itself to my sound chip I don't have a clue! I just recently put Win 7 on so I don't know how much different vs XP but it worked and no frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S. Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mic a while back as my first ever computer mic, not so good if you're soft spoken. It would either not pick up my voice at all, or pick up every sound in my room (and with the amount of electronics I have, turned into a constant annoying hum) I've moved on to headsets now, and really recommend people who are new to computer mics to get a headset instead. They look goofy and are a bit more expensive, but the quality is way better with less hassle of trying to find the perfect sound configuration for your voice/noise level
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Unique Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic to use while gaming since I use stereo headphones, I love it. The mic picks up and transmits my voice clearly and without any issues. Logitech makes some good products, and this is one of them, it's cheap and works well for what it's designed for. The cosmetic and artistic design is really unique and cool too, and the microphone arm goes up and down too. Would I recommend this product? Yes! It's a good microphone, not that expensive, and has a mute button that's easy to press on and off with a light signalling if the mic is on or off too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rauk

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be used by me for Skyping and personal notes and podcasting. It's literally plug and play, and was ridiculously easy to use it as my default in Audacity. (Literally, one drop down menu) It's crisp and clear when recording and during playback, so my main problem is to sit back and not overdue things. (Microphone too close to the face, too loud speaking, over-articulating). No idea how it sounds hooked to turntables, etc., but great for recording voices. It works with Windows 7, which relieved me, as that isn't listed in the manual. Manual is copyrighted 2003, so ignore that.
customer_reviews.author: Pudacat

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned one of these microphones and now bought this one as a gift. The sound quality is phenomenal -- using Skype the person on the other end can clearly hear everyone in my room or an adjacent room. I have plugged it into various computers, and the necessary drivers for the microphone have always installed with no action on my part. If you buy this microphone in a retail store, it will be in large, complicated packaging; but a small package is sent by Amazon -- when I saw it I wondered how the microphone could fit in there. Much better for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chaiken

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech microphone is so handy and easy to use! just plug the USB 2.0 to the computer or event to the USB hub and it will be recognized by the computer. With Mac machines will be no problem at all! when making a phone call using messenger or skype , your voice will sound clear and loud on the other end.. the person receiving your call will tell you how clear and crisp your voice sounds! When not using the microphone, is easy to push it back of the computer or to the side . is so compact and light. No need to make special room or arrangements with this mike.
customer_reviews.author: Pako

customer_reviews.title: One of the better quality mics out there.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of different mics from different price ranges, and a good deal of the ones in this price range and below are about the same quality as my cell phone (not great.) This one, however, is quite clear with minimal static. It's great for Skype and general voice recordings, though perhaps not so fine tuned as to work for lyrical recordings. It's also pretty durable, as before I bought this one, had the same model withstand years of moving around, falling over, and getting chewed by cats.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for use with Google Voice
customer_reviews.text: I first tried a Plantronic headset before I found this, Logitech desktop microphone is by far superior. I use mine to make long telephone calls with Google Voice and it works very well. Super easy to use, just plug it in and unmute your microphone/audio input in your sound settings. It clearly picks up sound from even 3-4 feet away so you aren't anchored to being right in front of the microphone all the time in order to be heard. I liked this one so much I have even bought additional microphones for my friends who don't already have a setup on their computer to make VOIP calls.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing I Bought All Year
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to use for my fantasy football drafts, as I Skype in because I live across the country from the rest of the league. Turns out I didn't need it, so it's sat around for a couple months. My fiance and I decided to buy some gifts for a family she works with who is poor and hasn't bought Xmas presents for their kids in like 5 years. The oldest son records his own music, but needed a better microphone, so buying this and then not needing it was almost fate. He was SO happy when he opened it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schirano

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I use this over the built-in mic in my laptop. The built-in mic had terrible static and people couldn't hear me well at all. I had to basically yell. This mic's noise canceling isn't impressive, but it's fairly sensitive and I can just talk normally and it'll transmit clearly. Great for VOIP, Ventrilo, and chatting to teammates in online games. I have no complaints and don't regret buying it. Just mind the number of USB ports you have left and feel free to plug this into a "shady" port such as hub or another accessory that provides more USB ports as it works well in 1.x as well as a 2.0 port.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Great noise-cancelling clear mic
customer_reviews.text: I had to turn the sensitivity to max, but this mic picks up clearly 20 inches away. I even have a loud fan in my room; I was impressed it was able to filter that out. I found it great for Skype and gaming. It sounds as good as any of the 4 other headsets/mics I've bought. My only complaint is minor, the LEDs are kind of annoying. I'd rather have a physical switch than another thing on my desk that's glowing. (edit) I have since stopped using this mic for gaming. I have a normal keyboard but if I transmit voice while pressing keys it sounds incredibly loud, so I'm switching back to a boom mic on a headset.
customer_reviews.author: David Rickard

customer_reviews.title: Better than it looks
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is perfect for Skype, Ventrilo, or any kind of voice recording. It requires only two steps to use- plug in, and turn on. It is durable, and has in fact survived many long plane flights shoves into my back pack, and has worked without fail for four years now. The sound quality is great, especially for something so small and inexpensive, though if you're looking to record music or multiple voices there are better options. Even if you're just skyping with your friends, though, it's a vast improvement over any laptop's internal microphone. Has an extremely long cord, if you're going to try to use it with a desktop computer.
customer_reviews.author: James Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I received it worked, but just barely.. I had to be an inch away from it in order to pick up any sound whatsoever. I messaged them and the return was easy/hassle free, got the new on the next day and it works! It works as it says it is supposed to work on the product description. I can be 5ft away and it can still pick my sound up at the same time cancel out the sound 10ft away. All in all it is great, I have Windows 7 and the drivers installed automatically, comes already ready! Work the $20.00 if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this microphone for skype calls on my computer. It works very well! I just plugged it in and my computer recognized it with no issues, so it worked right out of the box. The ability to pick up my voice, even at a distance is amazing. I can walk, hands and ears free, all around my office/workshop while on a call (I pace while on the phone) and the person on the other end never knows that I am not sitting right there in the chair. Good price, great performance, easy installation. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kaliona

customer_reviews.title: not impressive
customer_reviews.text: This mic was very easy to set up, and the sound quality is OK. It is difficult to get it set up so that it picks up your voice well without picking up background noise and the sounds of you breathing. I also found it hard to say the letter P without the mic picking it up as a very loud whooshing pop. I bought this to do podcasts but I don't think the quality is really up to the task. Actually, the mic I got for free when I signed up for Skype sounded better. This mic might be OK for phone conversations where the quality doesn't need to be so professional.
customer_reviews.author: M Owens

customer_reviews.title: Very good recording quality for narrations/tutorial recordings
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good quality noise canceling mic to record Tutorials. I was using the laptop's internal mic which was pretty decent but was recording the internal noise from the laptop fans as well. After considering some headsets with mic, I chose this one as it does not record my breathing sounds due to the distance from my mouth/face. The quality of the recording was very clean. I would not consider it very portable when compared to a headset/earphones with mic due to the size, but it works for me as I don't really travel with it much.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Works... kind of.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I decided to buy this microphone it looked like the perfect solution for me. Yes it is easy to use and it doesn't need any extra software, basically plug and play. However the main and most important feature: "noise canceling" DOES NOT WORK!. I'm really disappointed. I don't know if I got a defective product or what, I tried both my macbook and a pc, and the noise background still happens. You can still hear the noise in the background. Notice however using this microphone is better than using the built-in one. Anyway, I will continue looking for a cheap and decent microphone. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Mario C

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound for a low cost
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use for Skype calls to our families overseas. It handled the cross-world trip in a suitcase well and an earthquake as well. The sound quality is very good and the device is easy to use. No instillation software needed. The mic can be folded up, which makes it useful for storage and for travel. I'm sure there are other way more expensive devices out there that work better, but for the low price, this is a good value. I would recommend this to anyone needing a mic for Skype calls overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install-sould quailty is excellent! Great USB Microphone!
customer_reviews.text: This LOGITECH USB Microphone is well made and easy to install. Just plug into a USB port and go! The mike has a light that comes on when the mike is active and ready to use. It has great sound quality and I am very happy with my purchase. In addition, I have used this microphone in PowerPoint and also in other programs where I need to narrate and the sound quality is excellent. The best this is the ON and OFF switch at the base of the microphone which is a feature found on the more expensive microphones. So I 100% recommend this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy STop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great with Vista
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with my Creative mic and webcam mic till I was about to throw both out the window, I came across this gem. Talk about ease of use - just plug it in. I'm a WoW addict (/cry) and needed a mic for Vent. This mic works perfectly for me in Vista32. I renamed the device in setup so it stood out when I was selecting my input device in WoW and Vent. Voice clarity is great and the base mute button is nice (when you want to make sure a guildy doesn't hear you cursing them). I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W

customer_reviews.title: Nice, good looking, quality Internet mic, AND IT WORKS VERY WELL! :)
customer_reviews.text: We use this mic for phone calls over the Internet. Just plug the sucker into a USB port and you are good to go. It comes across the Internet crisp and clear, keeps up with your voice, and most important of all, it clearly picks up my wife's voice as she paces the flood behind me, or from the doorway! We've used it for a couple of hours, during this first week, and have gotten no complaints from those that we have called. In fact, they don't even know that we are communicating over the Internet. It is well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Machaon

customer_reviews.title: Superb! Better than you'd ever think!!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of iffy upon purchasing this item so I could talk with my friends over chatting systems, but this item proved be wrong!! It's better than I had thought!! When I was talking with one friend, he said he could hear dogs from outside my window, airplanes flying over my house, trains that echoed through the dead of night! It was awesome! I know on most programs it blocks out background sound, but this microphone on programs such as Skype certainly doesn't do that, not that it matters. This item is worth your money! Guarantee!
customer_reviews.author: Count von Kit

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Mic For The Price -- I'm Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a very decent microphone for the price. I use it with Audacity, and I'm able to create clear voice recordings. I do get a few pops on my "P's" and some other hard sounds, but I found that by moving my mouth away from the mic at an angle really helped that. Play with it a bit, test different angles and distances, and you should be able to find that perfect "spot". The mic is back-and-forth adjustable, the base has a lengthy USB cord, and there is also an on-and-off switch. A nice buy for the price ...
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as a speaker phone mic for my laptop for over a month. Not one person has made any comment at all about the quality of my calls. And that was the point. It just works. I think the day I got it I played around with the mic volume on my laptop, but since then, just works perfect. I like the mute button on the base of the mic. (its lit when they can hear you, off when they can't) I would recommend this to anyone who is looking to use there computer as a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Reece Fam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for video-chatting, Good for recording
customer_reviews.text: Definitely good enough for video chatting, but I bought it for recording. It is extremely clear, provided you set it up the right way, but it is also extremely sensitive, so you will have to be recording in a quiet place, and don't ever speak/sing right into the mic. If you are looking for a recording mic but can't afford a $60+ mic (such as snowball), this is a good alternative. Just a note: since it is a USB mic, you can't hear any instantaneous playback while recording (delayed playback can be set up in mic properties, but that's pretty much useless).
customer_reviews.author: Jyyer Law

customer_reviews.title: Works FINE under Vista (and Linux too)
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what some reviewers have said, this microphone works just fine under Vista. If you have kept your Vista current with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and subsequent updates, you should have no problem. For the record, I am using Vista Home Premium with SP1 and all updates through June 5, 2008. And a note for Linux users: My preferred operating system is Ubuntu, version 8.04. I can report that the Logitech USB mic works perfectly with this OS too. I have used Audacity under both Vista and Ubuntu to make excellent recordings with this mic.
customer_reviews.author: bleepingbeep

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Mute Button
customer_reviews.text: If you jiggle the mute button while the light is on, a loud audible noise is heard, and is incorporated into the digital output stream. This is a very bad thing for someone who frequently uses the mute button. I'm surprised so many people haven't noticed this, but it is a serious design flaw for the analog section to be picking up this noise. Other than that, the audio qualities are excellent for a $20 desktop mic. Almost no hiss, good directionality, and good fidelity.
customer_reviews.author: Goober

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Dragon Naturally Speaking with microphones much more expensive than this one. I had various problems. Driver conflicts. Uncomfortable placement - they only worked where they got in the way, bad sound, etc. I never wanted a head set, so I decided to try this microphone. It got its own drivers. I didn't have to download them. So it is now connected to the Logitech G19 keyboard, next to the Logitech Performance MX mouse, and surrounded by Logitech speakers. And Dragon likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a microphone just for gaming and speaking with friends on skype and this certainly does the trick. The design is fantastic, love the illuminated on/off button rather than push-to-talk and the cord length was definitely what I needed. Is it podcasting quality voice? Of course not, and you shouldn't expect it to be for this price range. But the sound quality was excellent when talking to friends and family or when gaming. I've had this product over a year without any problems whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good desktop microphone
customer_reviews.text: Microphone is very easy to install and easy to use. It's light weight to put in my laptop's backpack for recording some projects. However, the clarity recording is not very cleared, it sounded like I have stuffy nose. Other than that, I like the fact that Amazon always offers better prices than Best Buy and Fry's. Also, microphone came in a brown paperback box, I realized it is Logitech method to help the environment to recycle and reduce the plastic usages, which I don't mind and give props to Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: K. NGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: Simple, High Quality, a Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I use the microphone to record occasional instructional videos, and I could not be more satisfied with how well it works. The assembly could not possibly be simpler - just open the package, take out the microphone, and plug it into a USB slot in your computer. Sit about a foot or so away, and start talking. That's it - you're up and running! The recording quality is very high, almost amazingly high based on the low price of this product. I'd highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent audio problems
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this microphone, but I struggled with it for 2 years. It will intermittently perform very badly, and other callers noticed my voice would suddenly sound like I was "in a cave". Other times, it functioned ok. The feature that does make this microphone great is the large mute button on the base. This was nice for conference calls, where I am sometimes doing little or no talking.
customer_reviews.author: number 37

customer_reviews.title: Microphone for MAC
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it for about a month now and my wife and I love it for it's ease of installation, ease of use and good sound quality. We both have Macs and use them from different rooms in our house. We use SKYPE and turn off the video, just using the audio. Works great for staying in communication. I would recommend them to anyone needing a microphone that can be muted easily, needs to be away from the main laptop and has very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: BMWTriker

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised by how well this captures my voice. I thought I would have to speak loudly, but not at all. I can talk normally or even quietly and it will capture the audio perfectly. I have used this for over a year now and it works as good now as it did when I first purchased it. I do take care of it, so if you do too, then it will last you a long time. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Baseball Rocks!

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted...
customer_reviews.text: Got it today, installed it on my Windows XP laptop, followed the instructions on volume adjustment and it's great. I then took it to my Windows Vista desktop and installed it, adjusted the volume per the instructions and it works great. When you receive the microphone, the volume may be set too low in your computer. You may need to go to the sound icon in settings to adjust up the volume to your liking. All in all a very sleek and nice microphone, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Super Duper Microphone
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so... You can't record an album using this mic. It won't get your on American Idol or put you in Simon's good graces.... But for the price and value, it cannot be beat. It is literally as simple as plug and play... No drivers or disk to mess with. The mute button is also especially handy for voice chat. I really thought the reviews were too good to be true for a simple USB mic, but this one lives up to its 5-star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F.

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone for doing dictation into Dragon Naturally Speaking. It works great! I am using Windows 7 and all I did was plug in the microphone and it was instantly usable. I was surprised how well it worked with Dragon. I made a couple of calls over Skype and the sound was great, according to the other party. I made phone calls from GMail and the sound was fabulous! What a great item for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Greg

customer_reviews.title: Sweet on the cheap end!
customer_reviews.text: Logitech continues to make great products, atd good prices, and this ones no different. Installation is simple, and was my reason for suggesting it to another friend of mine that is blind and uses a screen reader to control her computer. You can just sit back and allow the microphone to take you to the conversation. The only gripe I have with it is that, while you can adjust it up and down it does not swivel. That would be a nice touch to add. Good show!
customer_reviews.author: Forereel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic microphone!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a very low price and was pleasantly surprised with the quality. I used to use a webcam-integrated microphone and did not think this would be a huge improvement, but as it turns out, it most definitely was. However if you are looking for something professional, I'd not advise getting this. I did use it to record screencasts for various online tutorials, and for that purpose it's truly great, but do not record yourself singing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Not very packable, but nonetheless great!
customer_reviews.text: The combination of the odd base and microphone shaft make it hard to pack this to-go (given how fragile the connection between the two looks) but as a stationary mic it's pretty awesome! I've never used high-quality microphones before, but it doesn't have the static problem that my built-in mic has. It does record sounds a *little* off (I play viola), but it's better than anything I've gotten bundled with a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Tai Siapno

customer_reviews.title: -) Treat it well and it can last easily for 10 years
customer_reviews.text: My 6-year-old same microphone still works perfectly. It is just getting old and tired looking, so I just replaced it. :-) Treat it well and it can last easily for 10 years. Works great with Dragon speech recognition in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Hani

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My expensive headset as crazy as this may seem was starting to give me headaches. So I thought for the price I would give this a go. My friends that I talk to on Skype say that the sound is a 100% better than the old headphone with Mic that I was using. The cord is nice and long so you have room to put it where you want it at. I love the on and off button it lights up green and I can easily turn it off if I need privacy. I would not hesitate to purchase this item at all!
customer_reviews.author: Sarabear

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great entry-level mic for podcasting or recreational recording. I created a little pop filter from pantyhose, which went a long way to improving sound, but for someone who was just getting into recording and knew nothing, you can't beat this mic for the price. I still use it when I'm too lazy to set up my more expensive rig.
customer_reviews.author: edoug

customer_reviews.title: It Serves its Purpose Well
customer_reviews.text: Had this for three years, and it is still performing great on my computer. I used this to communicate on TeamSpeak/Ventrillo when playing Star Wars:The Old Republic with my guild and running raids. Also used on Skype with my Grandma. I had thought about graduating to a gamer headset, but this one is fine at the moment. Although it is not as fancy and elegant as other gamer headsets out there, it gets the job done quite well.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Excellence Again
customer_reviews.text: Having tried another unsatisfactory brand of microphone for my computer, I talked with my grandson about it and he recommended Logitech for "anything." I had inadvertently forgotten to order an internal mic for my computer last summer - although I have the webcam, which works just fine - I was stuck needing a mic to webcam with my clients. I enthusiastically recommend this instrument. It is simple to install, use, and is unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: DeVee

customer_reviews.title: So much easier than a headset
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very active PC gamer and due to an old ear infection, wearing headsets always caused discomfort for me, yet what is a gamer to do? Well, a friend with similar problems told me about the desk mic, and I bought this one and found it solved all my problems. It's clear, easy to place and doesn't have to be right close to me when I'm speaking. Fabulous and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kazren

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This mic is about four levels up in sound quality compared to a conventional 3.5mm mic. I don't really notice any noise canceling during recordings. I don't know if it's a feature that needs to be activated. I guess it filters white noise. Sound quality is great, there is zero electrical interference or brown noise to be heard. This mic is good enough to use in a studio for recording demos and instrumentals, guitar riffs, journals, etc. A suggestion, use Audacity or Nero Wave Editor to do all your recording. Both programs are easy to use with this mic and selecting recording quality is easy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Slender Microphone
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the performance, quality and good look of our new Logitech USB Desktop Microphone. I like that it can fold down to be out of the way, when not in use or to keep from interfering with the viewing area. And, of course, Amazon delivered on time and in packaging adequately protecting the product from any damage. We know that we can count on Logitech for quality products.
customer_reviews.author: JoyS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a bad microphone during gaming for months. People could barely understand me. I knew it was a connection issue but wasn't sure if it was the 3.5mm jack on the microphone or computer and I didn't have another one to test that. As soon as I purchased this one, all those problems disappeared. I didn't have to install anything, so setup was easy. I can talk to people with the microphone about 1ft away and they can understand me without any issues, even with music playing in the background in the same room. The button on it makes it easy to just leave the microphone plugged in but turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great voice quality and no feedback when talking on Skype on a Mac- W
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Installs easily and works fine on my MacBook Pro running OS X 10.4 - Super easy installation: plug it in, change one setting in System Preferences > Sound > Input - Good sound quality on Skype - No feedback (I had lots while using the MacBook's internal microphone) - A simple, easily accessed mute on/mute off button Cons: - None that I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Al Sargent

customer_reviews.title: The best mic on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: The greatest mic, very simple, very easy to use. This mic is plug and use, voice is clear, sounds are great, does not pick up a lot if not any surrounding sound. All my friends and both my brothers bought this after they heard me and they tried it out themselves. Highly recommend this mic if your can get it cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Leung

customer_reviews.title: nice mic, involved install
customer_reviews.text: The microphone works great, but I had to rummage through the internet to find out why it did not work at first. It involved going to the control panel and adjusting the mic sound setting from 0 to something usable. This microphone would have easily gotten 5 stars if Logitech had anything packaged with the microphone to explain that the microphone volume may need adjustment and steps to do that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Was working ...
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be working just fine. The sound quality was good. We used it mostly for Skype conversations and online interactive courses. However, it is cheaply made, and inevitably stopped working. Cannot figure out was is wrong with it, nothing looks broken. It lasted less than four months. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: mumto4boys

customer_reviews.title: Great USB microphone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had this microphone for a few years... Still going strong and never had an issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anas M. Mughal

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with Windows XP SP3. Plug and play, no drivers needed. Clear sound recording and I really like the "on air" toggle button that lights up when the mic is unmuted. One minor issue is that if you do any serious audio editing or at least like to tinker with recording settings, there really isn't any documentation of what sample size and rates this mic supports. Different sound recording applications seem to have different levels of success "guessing" what this mic can and can't do for sound capture.
customer_reviews.author: Dwaine Gonyier

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With Vista Home Premium
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this product because there were reviews that said it wouldn't work with Windows Vista. Wrong! It works just fine. I did have to go to the control panel (new view not classic), click hardware and sound, and then the recording tab. The logitech had become the default, but under configure I found the volume was on its lowest setting. Once the volume setting was adjusted it worked great. The item does what it says it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Van Vlack

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I am new to voice recording, and this specific microphone was recommended to me by voice over talent agent Jeffrey Umberger. I had to rush and complete my first audition for a voice over gig, and setup and installation were both easy. My mic is set up in the living room area, where background noise is easily heard. Despite this, the mic did not pick up any outside noise, only my voice.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader and Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, as long as you do something first
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, when I first used this microphone, I noticed everything I recorded was barely audible. Then I realized I could change the input level of the microphone under the sound setting in the control panel. Once I did that, I found the microphone to work very well. It will be more than enough for my simple youtube aspirations.
customer_reviews.author: theboombody

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, so-so construction.
customer_reviews.text: I was very sad when the black plastic rod part broke near the bottom. If you house can be hectic like mine, you might want a microphone with a more solid construction. If it's going to be out of reach at all times, including during use, you should be fine. It worked well for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this microphone is fantastic. I use it for commentary on a lot of videos and for a time, skype video chats near-daily, so I needed something that would be as good of quality as possible while on a student budget. I've had mine for about 9 months now, and it's just now starting to wear down for the bit that holds the angle of its aim, and the audio is still coming through perfectly fine. For a 20$ buy, I'd say that's pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Classy Book-Nerd

customer_reviews.title: My Logitech microphone is great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Logitech USB microphone to use with my voice recognition mainly. It works like a charm. I had a lot of trouble in the past with other microphones that did not work well but this one works great. I am so glad I purchased it. $114.00? Really? Just one added comment. I paid abut 12.99 for this microphone a few years back.
customer_reviews.author: LucyintheSky

customer_reviews.title: Easy to break
customer_reviews.text: This microphone has really good sound quality, but the connection to the base is really easy to break. We use them at our college, but had to switch to another product because their price went up and because they break easily. If you keep in one location and do not move it around a lot this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: This mic was recognized by Windows XP as soon as I plugged it in. All I had to do was to push its obvious power button (which lights up when the mic is on) and I had clear Skype calls while using a PC speaker less than 1 foot away from the unit. No problems after a year. The lighted 'on' button is a useful feature. Other mics have not worked nearly as well. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just ok microphone
customer_reviews.text: I decided to spend a few more dollars to get a microphone that detected clearly my 6 old daughter's voice for practicing with rossetta stone but unfortunately this mic did not meet my expectations. It is ok but sometime in order to work ok one needs to speak very close to the mic. It is better than my previous mic. but that one was very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Heen

customer_reviews.title: Solid mic
customer_reviews.text: Still working after four years, however the mute button has "broken". I put broken in quotes as it still functions, but doesn't entirely mute my voice, only drastically lower the volume. As my friends put it, "it makes you sound like you're in the other room".
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: A little over 2 years and still going strong. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in December of 2012 and I'm still using this microphone as of today, January 2015. I'd use this with Skype, Mumble, and Ventrilo and I'd be about 1 ft away from the mic and my friends never complained about me being inaudible. This gets the job done but this ain't nothing you'd want to record the next Kanye album on. For you and me, the quality is fair.
customer_reviews.author: kirbyderby

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a similar product that plugged into the microphone jack on my computer and getting horrible results I gave this a try. The sound quality was excellent, and it was plug-and-play. I attribute the improvement in sound quality to the microphone, not the different method of connection: better dynamics, noise rejection, and overall clearer more natural sound.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A. Knopf

customer_reviews.title: Clarity at last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in order to skype with my daughter while i'm on the road. Her notebook's built-in microphone was horrible. Looked at a few options and settled on this one. Good price, great clarity and volume. USB connectivity, On/Off switch (lighted), plug and play. Really no set-up required with windows 7. Plug it in and start using! This Mic sounds great. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Easy Plug and Speak
customer_reviews.text: definitely a great buy for its price range. I was using a cheap headset with a mic and the sound quality was good, but I couldn't wear it for more then an hour or so before feeling uncomfortable. With this mic I'm able to use my speakers and not worry about being attached to the computer from my head. Pros: Plug and Play no driver necessary, Cheap, Arcs forward closer to you, Hardware mute button that lights up when it not muted. Cons: Naturally you have to be somewhat close to the mic to use it. Other Thoughts: it doesn't make you a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Logitech USB Desktop Microphone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent audio quality. Works well with Skype. Works well with a Mac. Just remember to go to your system preferences, select sound, select input, then highlight the correct microphone. Mine says "AK5370". And that's on my Mac. Then adjust the input volume level. For me, the highest setting works best. And that's it! I use it often and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Koster

customer_reviews.title: Fairly clear microphone, but the biggest problem with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly clear microphone, but the biggest problem with it is that the spot where the microphone connects to the stand is very weak. Mine snapped and I had to tape it in place. Cheap construction, but worth about what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: needs an interface of some sort
customer_reviews.text: this thing is a good mic. want to say that first. the problem is.... it is too sensitive. my speakers are three feet above my mic. they are pointed out into an open room. and i have to turn them down to where i can almost not hear in order to keep peeps on skype from having to listen to what im doing. this is a huuuuuuuuuge annoyance
customer_reviews.author: needa

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, easy-open eco packaging means easy access (no fighting with hard plastic/easy to recycle). Plug in USB 2.0, driver installs in less than a minute, push the button and talk. Works great for weekly skype calls to Europe/Caribbean - my family can finally hear me clearly. Love it. If you need a free standing mic, get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Npetra1

customer_reviews.title: Great mic, excellent sound quality, awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a no frills mic to record youtube videos on or chat VOIP, this is perfect for both. It is directional enough to sound clear, but not so much as to lock you into a single position. The on-off button on the base is very handy as well. Avoid recording a mushy, noisy, hiss filled voice-over, use this mic!
customer_reviews.author: E. Webber

customer_reviews.title: A winner
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these microphones mostly to use with Skype. They were very easy to set up, the computers recognized them and they were working immediately. We have had no problems. Occasionally the person at the other end of the phone would complain of a strong echo but I am not sure if this due to Skype or the microphone picking up sounds from the computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive microphone to talk to my son in England thru Skype
customer_reviews.text: High tech looking device. Easily connected to USB port of laptop (Compaq computer using VISTA operating system). Software drivers automatically downloaded. Microphone works well with Skype. Two points - (1) seems you have to be somewhat closer to the mic for the other party to hear you clearly, than I thought you would need to be, and (2) the USB port on the right side of the computer would not work (ended up using a USB port of the left side of the computer). But overall easy to set up and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: 26 year banker

customer_reviews.title: great design--feel and function
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these after I saw one at my parents' house. Let's face it--microphone technology does not have to be very big. We have them in cell phones, built-into laptops, and even in those super-sneaky pens with hidden recorders. However....this microphone just looks and feels like it is reliable, and it also functions excellently. I also loved the ease of set-up when I mailed one to a relative.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Boley

customer_reviews.title: This is the best USB desktop Microphone with on off switch.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a desktop microphone to have great quality and having on/off switch was a must, this price and being Logitech brand is amazing itself, I got 4 of them for the company I work for, for online presentations and all other professional usage except singing ;) and we love it. (I have Masters in computer engineering, so u can trust me on this).
customer_reviews.author: Sina

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Microphone works fine but keeps falling down base does not hold it up straight.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I like having a mic seperate from headphones and this has provided me with just what I needed. It doesn't take up much space and the sound quality for it is just fine.. no distortion or any problems of the kind. Quite sensitive when necessary. I've talked with a friend over Skype while wondering around a... 250sqft room(?) without any difficulties being heard.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech CE works well with Mac Mini
customer_reviews.text: Mic works well with Mac Mini for narrating screencasts. Just plug it in, point the mic toward your mouth, go to System Preferences>Sound>Input and select AK5370 with USB, Up the input to maximum volume, test your voice to see its range, adjust as needed, and then go to your recording program and record. No need to download drivers. I bought mine used and hope that it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SolarL

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bend-ability
customer_reviews.text: While the recording quality of this microphone is great, the microphone piece is too loose from the base of the device, making it difficult-to-impossible to position it at a preferred angle. It often will just fall to the bottom unless I force it to its limits at the top. Alas, it has poor "bend-ability" attributes.
customer_reviews.author: Z.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic
customer_reviews.text: I adore this mic. I was stoked to see the packaging it came in too. This mic wants to save the world. I needed a mic for my Mac Pro... mainly for google voice. I have a 27 inch LED display so the mic on this thing isn't that great. Now when I talk to people, they don't feel like they are on speakerphone. My only complaint is that I wish it looked a little closer to Bob Barkers mic. I almost feel like him when I talk into it!
customer_reviews.author: jeremyejackson

customer_reviews.title: Superb recording quality - especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone to replace a less expensive one that I have long been disappointed with for editing home videos. But who knew (except those that own one) how GOOD this mic records?! Crystal clear from a comfortable distance from my voice, and I even tested whispering to check its quality. Outstanding! Don't let this get away - GREAT value and performance!
customer_reviews.author: SwingBack

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great, but broke easily
customer_reviews.text: I loved my microphone until about 3 months into using it when the microphone stem snapped neatly off the base. I had just dropped it once off my desk onto the floor, barely a 2-foot drop onto carpet, and it didn't hold up at all. It was right at the base of the microphone stem where it's at it's thinnest & weakest point. Poorly designed, in my opinion. Either a different material other than plastic, or a thicker base would have easily prevented this being an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: I now own 2 of these, great Microphones!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 1 a year ago then purchased my seconded a month or so back... for another computer in the house. They have great pickup and at the same time provide noise reduction. I sit with the microphone 20-24 inch from my mouth and they pickup great with a clear sound for the people on the other side of the conversation. some loud back ground noises can be heard slightly but do not disturb the conversion. These Microphones are great!
customer_reviews.author: Trampas Matney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microphone
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for about 2 years and it's great.. never fails me...nice bright green light button tells me when it's on. clear audio for skype, for voice overs in video recording and google hangouts. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bio Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Good USB External Microphone
customer_reviews.text: Really like this microphone. Easily plugs in the USB port and has an on/off button on the base. If you need an external mic, this is a great option. The only minor drawback is that you need to have it fairly close to when speaking, but other than that, sound is clear and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Young

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I make videos on YouTube which require commentary. This microphone seemed to be my only option, considering my limited funds, so I went ahead and bought it. This microphone, surprisingly, has pretty good sound quality. Aside from the awkward design, it's a great microphone. The only thing I don't like about it, is how weird the design is. I prefer either a microphone on a headset, or a microphone that looks like a Blue Yeti. These are both far more expensive, so I had to settle for this. All in all, great for a beginner with microphones and audio equipment, but keep in mind that there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan V

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: This USB microphone is very simple plug and play -- and play it does! It is absolutely perfect for Google Voice or for similar voice-only uses. The extra long cord is a major plus, too, as is the superior sound quality of the device. Overall, there's absolutely nothing not to like about this reasonably-priced quality microphone.
customer_reviews.author: SRT-6

customer_reviews.title: Hard to mess up a mic
customer_reviews.text: This is useful if you don’t want to wear a headset. Works well for gaming, skyping, whatever. I don’t have to lean over to put my mouth on top of the mic and my friends say they could hear me just fine, better than when using my Creative headset mic, in fact.
customer_reviews.author: J. Valenzona

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a microphone to complement my built-in monitor webcam so that I could use video chat on my home computer. I received this product quickly, set it up in less than a minute, turned it on and was ready to video chat. I have used it for 3 chats already and the people on the other end had no complaints about my voice clarity. This product completely satisfied my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Kunzelman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but volume is low.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this microphone for about 2 years. Design is great, feels great, but the only thing is: you should speak into it (if you want to be heard in normal way). When the distance is 30-50 cm (11-20 in), your companion may think you are talking from another part of your room. Even if you set system volume at 100%. May be it is a problem for all desktop microphones. Right now i'm using regular headset (headphones+microphone).
customer_reviews.author: GennadyKarasev
